page.title: 02JOSEPH FARQUHARSON RA.
page.content: Joseph Farquharson of{Finzean}R.A.was born in Edinburgh in 1846 and succeeded his brother Robert as Laird in 1918.He was 13 years old when he first exhibited at the Royal Scottish Academy in 1859.He exhibited there and at the Royal Academy for much of his life. A good portrait painter,he specialised more in pastoral{landscapes}and is especially famous for his snow scenes and woodland sunsets many of which still hang in{Finzean homes.} He died in 1935 and,after a period of relative obscurity,his pictures in 1985 are much sought after,one selling for Â£45,000 to America recently. Many of his pictures were of{Finzean} and an exhibition of his works is on show in Edinburgh,Aberdeen and London.
